text: How do you PEP 8-name a class whose name is an acronym?
I try to adhere to the style guide for Python code (also known as PEP 8).
Accordingly, the preferred way to name a class is using CamelCase:
How can I be consistent with PEP 8 if my class name is formed by two acronyms (which in proper English should be capitalized).
For instance, if my class name was 'NASA JPL', what would you name it?

code:
class NASAJPL():  # 1
class NASA_JPL(): # 2
class NasaJpl():  # 3

text: I am using #1, but it looks weird; #3 looks weird too, and #2 seems to violate PEP 8.
While the question really does not have a 'correct' answer, I benefited a lot from your insights.
I will be resorting to a #3: better to be consistently wrong (in the sense of having an acronym/abbreviation as a Title) than inconsistently right.
